Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

When I moved my Bookmark Menu Items from the bookmarks bar to the Addon bar, the item would not collapse, and instead left space to the right of all my bookmarks. It is remaining the same size as it appears as using the Customize option.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Reduce bookmarks to one or two
2. Firefox -> Options -> Toolbar Layout
3. Drag "Bookmark Toolbar Items" to the addon bar.
4. Close Customize dialog box
Actual Results:  
The Bookmarks Toolbar Items will be larger than expected, with extra space to the right.

Expected Results:  
The Bookmarks Toolbar Items will shrink to fit the current number of bookmarks on it.

At first I thought it acted like a Flexible Space, but it really just seems to have a fixed width when it should not.

comments.text:
This problem still exists in Firefox 7.0a1, and is also a problem on Windows 7.

Seeing as it's the exact same amount of space left for the moving Bookmarks button (that jumps from the Navigation Toolbar whenever the Bookmark Toolbar Items are visible), it might be related to that.

Adding additional flexible spaces on the left will scoot the items to the right, but with diminishing returns. After a fourth space, the items will no longer scoot.
